## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey! I'm here to help with any Verus-related questions you might have. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I want to try out the new protocols on the Verus testnet. How can I get a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies?

**AI Assistant:**
You can get a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies by visiting the Verus Discord and asking in the #pbaas-development channel. You can join the Verus Discord using this link: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf. They'll be able to help you out with that. Do you have any other questions about the testnet?

**User:**
Actually, I do. What is the Verus DeFi Testnet, and what are its key features?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that is currently testing new capabilities and protocols before they are released on the mainnet. Some of its key features include 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake consensus algorithms, worldwide availability, and the implementation of new Verus protocols. It's important to note that all currencies and assets on the testnet have no value and may be reset at any time to facilitate testing. Does that help clarify things?

**User:**
Yeah, that helps. What is the purpose of the `getcurrencyconverters` RPC API in the Verus DeFi Testnet?

**AI Assistant:**
The `getcurrencyconverters` RPC API (final name to be determined at mainnet) enables system-wide queries for fractional basket currencies for arbitrage, investment discovery, or conversion bargain hunting. This API allows wallets or applications to instantly query any full node for all registered currencies above a fixed liquidity threshold that contain one or more reserve currencies, determining the best conversion rates at acceptable liquidity levels. It's a powerful tool for exploring and utilizing the testnet's capabilities. Do you have any more questions about the API or the testnet?

**User:**
Actually, I do. What is the significance of the DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integrated with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm in the Verus DeFi Testnet?

**AI Assistant:**
This integrated protocol is a major innovation in the Verus DeFi Testnet, taking DeFi capabilities further than any other project in crypto today. It combines DeFi and cross-currency liquidity with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, and features a 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm. This protocol has far-reaching implications, allowing for rent-free and decentralized public blockchain functionality. It's a game-changer for the industry, and we're excited to see where it takes us!
How can I get a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies to try out the new protocols?

You can get a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies by visiting the Verus Discord and asking in the #pbaas-development channel. You can join the Verus Discord using this link: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf.

## The New Verus DeFi Testnet This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever announced, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf- **DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integrated with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm** - This is a massive set of platform capabilities that take DeFi further than any project in crypto today. We will list it here and describe it below. Using it is simple. Understanding the implications of what such a protocol can do when rent free and integrated in a truly decentralized public blockchain is a process of realizations that is likely to be similar to layers of an onion. We will do our best to explain below.- **System-wide queries for fractional basket currencies for arbitrage, investment discovery, or conversion bargain hunting** - The new RPC API, `getcurrencyconverters` (final name at mainnet, TBD), enables instant queries of any full node for all registered currencies above a fixed liquidity threshold that contain one or more reserve currencies. This new API enables wallets or applications to easily query the entire blockchain network of fractional currencies, determine which provides the best conversion rate at acceptable liquidity, and either convert at the best possible rates worldwide, or select only better-than-market rates and arbitrage to earn.
What is the Verus DeFi Testnet, and what are its key features?

The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that is currently testing new capabilities and protocols before they are released on the mainnet. Some of its key features include 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake consensus algorithms, worldwide availability, and the implementation of new Verus protocols. It's important to note that all currencies and assets on the testnet have no value and may be reset at any time to facilitate testing.
